intro: Rytigynia friesiorum, commonly known as the Brazilian pepper tree, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces red berries that are an important food source for various bird species. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in wetlands and disturbed soils. Due to its invasive nature in some regions, it is considered a problematic species in ecological management.
